metadata.title: CVE-2015-5343 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in util.c in mod_dav_svn in Apache Subversion 1.7.x, 1.8.xbefore 1.8.15, and 1.9.x before 1.9.3 allows remote authenticated users tocause a denial of service (subversion server crash or memory consumption)and possibly execute arbitrary code via a skel-encoded request body, whichtriggers an out-of-bounds read and heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
libapache2-svn - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
libsvn-java - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
libsvn-perl - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
libsvn1 - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
python-subversion - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
ruby-svn - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
subversion - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
subversion-tools - 1.9.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-1ubuntu1').
